paragraphs.name: c6e8
paragraphs.text: What I would like to see here is a donation button or an option to pay as much as one wants for a subscription or to writers directly. I want to be my own editor and be able to pay writers regardless of what your team thinks.
I didn’t come here for your editorial team. I couldn’t care less about it. I came here for the writers, amazing, new, fresh writers, first timers and those who have been writing for years.

paragraphs.name: eaf2
paragraphs.text: I certainly do not appreciate how all this has been handled and what I’m getting as a paying member. I also do not appreciate how this whole idea is presented as ‘original’ and ‘unprecedented,’ when there is, frankly, not much originality in what is going on right now.

Besides, as In said, and I repeat, I’m not here for the curated content. We should all be our own editors and have the ability to pay the writers instead of handing over that right to Medium team only. That’s what bothers me most. I do not need a middle man to make such decisions for me. If Medium took a percentage of what WE choose to pay writers, I’d be fine with that.
paragraphs.name: c5f7
83d4
paragraphs.text: I would say your editors pick what I might like in one of ten cases. Meaning, I occasionally read and like a story that was recommended by your team. On average, I check no more than 1 to 2 links in your daily email selection.

2731f3c90cce.title: You’ve really nailed it here, Mateja.

paragraphs.name: 904f
paragraphs.text: You’ve really nailed it here, Mateja. The magical thing about the old Medium was the ease and regularity with which I seemed to stumble across unexpected stories that caught my imagination, and amazing new writers to follow. The new Medium is so heavily over-curated that I never seem to stumble across anything new anymore. It’s like all the wild…

virtuals.subtitle: Although I follow mainly fiction/flash fiction/poetry tags I barely see stories I like.

paragraphs.text: And that’s exactly why we need to avoid the same old ‘editor’s choice’ approach to this. Do you really think Medium is not interested in how many reads and recommendations articles get? That would be terribly naive…

paragraphs.name: cd9c
paragraphs.text: At the very least, we need a discussion on this. I want, for once, to be heard by Medium and have them take my (our) opinion into consideration.

Thank you, Mike. I love your work too and I agree about the fiction issue (as do many others, I’ve seen a lot of similar complaint and I passed mine on in the Medium member-only group). I love Bond’s work, as an example, but he disappeared and stop publishing on Medium, while his work is fantastic and written for someone like me who have seen what he…

This is so true. I’m new to medium but the donation and self subscription model works perfectly here. Medium could be the twitch for writers/publishers where people could actually make decent money and go all in on the platform.

9e9030fa8def.title: “So instead of scale for scale’s sake, the next phase of the media revolution will be creating…

paragraphs.name: bcbc
paragraphs.text: “So instead of scale for scale’s sake, the next phase of the media revolution will be creating content of consequence and value. It will continue to be messy but the trajectory for the coming decade is promising.” Things are not going to come out perfectly out of the box. That’s asking too much.

807148f9647e.title: I’m for this feature, in addition to the current membership set-up.

paragraphs.name: f7a7
paragraphs.text: I’m for this feature, in addition to the current membership set-up. I want to support writers I like, but I think it’s even more important to help create a body of work that’s less dependent on popularity or personal tastes, and more focused on informing us, and challenging us to look outside our opinion bubbles.

virtuals.subtitle: My life works just fine. I get my writing done; I need help publishing. I want the government to work even with Trump as president.

5d412941df33.title: Mateja, I look at my own behavior.

content.subtitle: My life works just fine. I get my writing done; I need help publishing. I want the government to work even with Trump as president.

paragraphs.text: Mateja, I look at my own behavior. Days are beginning to slip by when I don’t even click on the Medium daily digest button. Too much My Life’s Not Working, I Hate Trump, Here’s How to Make Your Life Work, How to Do a Fabulously Successful Start Up, How to Be a Better Writer.

40de55a58e36.title: I saw many who complained about the bias of Medium editors.

paragraphs.name: eff2
paragraphs.text: I saw many who complained about the bias of Medium editors. Whenever you have editors, you have bias and their personal taste. It’s close to impossible to avoid it and I’m not here for the curated content. They could have just created another publication or keep the hugely popular Matter alive instead of trying to turn the whole Medium into a giant publication.

paragraphs.name: ecfe
paragraphs.text: Hear, hear.

a7cf2386fd91.title: That’s what happens when people begin to create a product for themselves and not for the users.

paragraphs.name: c17c
paragraphs.text: That’s what happens when people begin to create a product for themselves and not for the users.

paragraphs.name: cb1e
paragraphs.text: yes. yes. yes.

eeeae0983b6f.title: This. Very few writers that I like ask for donations, even when I’m sure it might help them expand…

paragraphs.text: This. Very few writers that I like ask for donations, even when I’m sure it might help them expand their talents. So I have to ask them in a discreet and tactful way if I can. There must be a way this can be done that doesn’t otherwise interfere with their lives. A button would be great!

paragraphs.name: 06a4
paragraphs.text: Personally, I consider a Medium membership to be much better value than a subscription to the Washington Post, whose bias is apparent in nearly every headline and every article. I wouldn’t pay a penny for that. Here’s an article that supports the idea we’ll be paying for quality content one way or the other. It’s up to you to decide what you consider…

paragraphs.name: 2cab
paragraphs.text: You nailed it.

e9b678a63805.title: There is plenty of media that have already been creating a whole lot of high quality content of…

paragraphs.name: 6b76
paragraphs.text: There is plenty of media that have already been creating a whole lot of high quality content of consequence and value and they are finding it hard to survive on the subscription model, so why on earth is Medium following them down that road?! How is that revolutionary?!

They don’t need to be great because they play a different game than mainstream publications. Medium wants users to spend more time in the platform, even if that means it takes more clicks for you to find what…
